remarks: The international reference meridian as defined first by the 1884 International Meridian Conference and later by the Bureau International de l'Heure (BIH) and then the International Earth Rotation Service (IERS).
Value adopted by IGN (Paris) in 1936. Equivalent to 2째20'14.025". Preferred by EPSG to earlier value of 2째20'13.95" (2.596898 grads) used by RGS London.
1895 value.  Newer value of 7째26'22.335" determined in 1938.
Used in Austria and former Czechoslovakia.
Used in Greece for older mapping based on Hatt projection.
information_source: Topography Department; National Technical University of Athens.

remarks: Formerly known as Kristiania or Christiania.
Value replaced by IGN (France) in 1936 - see code 8903. Equivalent to 2.596898 grads.
